subject: Learning
title: Standardized Testing Begins
description: A quick win: understand Standardized Testing Begins.

hook.text: In 1905, Alfred Binet created the first intelligence test. He never intended it to rank children.

buildup.text: Binet designed it to identify children who needed extra helpâ€”not to label them as inferior.

discovery.text: The US Army adapted it for mass use in WWI, testing 1.7 million recruits. Standardized testing was born.

twist.text: Schools adopted it to sort students into tracks. A tool for help became a tool for ranking.

climax.text: By the 1960s, standardized tests determined college admissions, funding, and school reputations.

punchline.text: Binet built a diagnostic tool. Society turned it into a sorting machine.

quiz.question: What was Binet's original purpose for his intelligence test?
options: Identifying children who needed extra educational support
